metadata.title: Novel SARS-like Betacoronaviruses in Bats, China, 2011

abstract.original_text: To clarify the evolutionary relationships among betavoronaviruses that infect bats, we analyzed samples collected during 2010-2011 from 14 insectivorous bat species in China. We identified complete genomes of 2 novel betacoronaviruses in Rhinolophus pusillus and Chaerephon plicata bats, which showed close genetic relationships with severe acute respiratory syndrome coronaviruses.

sentences.segment_text: To clarify the evolutionary relationships among betavoronaviruses that infect bats ,
we analyzed samples collected during 2010-2011 from 14 insectivorous bat species in China .
We identified complete genomes of 2 novel betacoronaviruses in Rhinolophus pusillus and Chaerephon plicata bats ,
which showed close genetic relationships with severe acute respiratory syndrome coronaviruses .
